# Load libraries

```{r}
#| output: false
library(tidyverse)
library(psych)
library(polycor)
library(ggcorrplot)
```

# Load dataset

```{r}
# Load the CSV into a matrix
data <- read_csv("datoslago.csv")
summary(data)
```

# Get correlation matrix

```{r}
# Get the correlation matrix
corr_matrix <- corr.test(data, adjust = "none")
print(corr_matrix)
```

## Plot correlation matrix

```{r}
corr_matrix <- cor(data)

ggcorrplot(corr_matrix, type = "lower", lab = TRUE)
```

## Correlation Matrix interpetetation

The correlation matrix shows strong correlations on the following pairs:
- Proteinas -> Tamano (0.63)
- LnProteinas -> Tamano (0.84)
- LnProteinas -> Proteinas (0.78)
- LnTamano -> Proteinas (0.57)
- LnTamano -> Tamano (0.97)
